subject: Fashion
title: The True Cost of a $5 T-Shirt
description: A quick win: understand The True Cost of a $5 T-Shirt.

hook.text: You grab a $5 t-shirt. Great deal. But someone somewhere is paying the real price.

buildup.text: That $5 covers cotton farming, spinning, dyeing, cutting, sewing, shipping, and store profit.

discovery.text: The only way the math works is if garment workers earn almost nothingâ€”often $3 to $5 a day.

twist.text: Hidden costs pile up too: polluted rivers, depleted soil, and carbon from global shipping.

climax.text: A cheap price tag doesn't mean low cost. It means the cost was pushed onto people and the planet.

punchline.text: That $5 shirt has a real price. You just aren't paying it.

quiz.question: Why can a t-shirt be sold for as low as $5?
options: Advanced automation has eliminated most production costs
The true costs are shifted to underpaid workers and environmental damage
Government subsidies cover the majority of manufacturing expenses
